Here I am, writing an overdue blog post. Well my own site hasn't been updated for like erm fiften-leven days. Thats a good sign though, cause if I'm blogging everyday..it means my life is dead! more specific, i'm always staying at home facing the com.Well that was the reason I created my blog few weeks ago because I was dead bored that time.ahhAah okay a quick update on myself. I have another 1 month till college starts.So what I'm doing everyday now? My life is totally on the reversed. I sleep at 6am everyday[roughly la] and wakes up late afternoon..sometimes I just eat D`branch [breakfast + lunch + dinner] Now my activities just got started :p usually i'll watch the chinese drama on Astro 30 till 10.30 before calling my frens and join them. We usually lepakz till like 2 something before decidin where to go watch football! Then we'll chillout till ususally 5 something before going back.That cycle repeats everyday! So basically its a routine! Let's get back to business, where's the Starlight Cinema thing?Gone by the wind I suppose :P and miss jukumitz, I think yer shall go and consult doctor bout yer lil tummy. Don't delay anythin like that. Get someone to go along with you. I can fetch! :p Whats up with me and han yang? "we're just what we are". ahhahaa we aint changed much mmkayz. Still here anytime, just that our daily lifes aren't the same any longer. Haven't see karen n jewlie for ages actually.Weng Lum...I talk to him often. miracles! Kenny I've seen you at basketball.While the rest?I alwayz see you guys online..so do you too huh?! :p Thats all for now.Be lucky you get to read my post.Doesn't alwayz come out any longer or often too..its special.yak yak yak! peace out from me! fooked me!

If yoU need a friend.. don't look to a stranger.. yOu know in the end.. i'll always be there..... And when you're in doubt.. and when you're in danger.. take a look all around.. and i'll be there..... okaylar, just wanna say hie.. haven't heard from a lot of ppl in a while.. haven't spoken to li hua in ages.. somehow there's a mutual silence between me and kevin.. karen, thank God i am still close with.. and weng lum at least i talk to him quite a lot.. fookie and han yang, they're just them haha.. still not that long off since we've spoken - dats not too bad.. hehe.. and then ppl like kenny & edwin whu went missing.. kenny, which the last time i talked to him i was actually weng lum haha and edwin prob left for uni adi isit? and i have no idea at all.. eh what's up lar people.. form 6 is not too good.. i'm getting lazier by the day.. the amount of ppl in my class are also getting less and less, i think there are only about 10 left =P oh i've been having this stomach problem lah.. it gets really painful sometimes.. about 1 week already.. i'm thinking i should tell my mum? but she's in hong kong.. actually i did b4 she left but she didn't say anythin.. i wuz just reading up some stuff about stomach ulcer - you know how free i get when i'm online.. and(yucks btw) i think i'm being paranoid.. stupidly i'm just sitting here ignoring the pain everytime it comes.. haha.. will somebody please drag me to the doctor coz i think i need to see one.. *hugs* ppl!
ok whoever who did that fade thing GOOD JOB n im thinking the only person who knows how to do that n has already done it somewhere else is FOOKIE!! great job !

[IF] If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you, If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you But make allowance for their doubting too, If you can wait and not be tired by waiting, Or being lied about, don't deal in lies, Or being hated, don't give way to hating, And yet don't look too good, nor talk too wise: If you can dream--and not make dreams your master, If you can think--and not make thoughts your aim; If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster And treat those two impostors just the same; If you can bear to hear the truth you've spoken Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools, Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken, And stoop and build 'em up with worn-out tools: If you can make one heap of all your winnings And risk it all on one turn of pitch-and-toss, And lose, and start again at your beginnings And never breath a word about your loss; If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew To serve your turn long after they are gone, And so hold on when there is nothing in you Except the Will which says to them: "Hold on!" If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue, Or walk with kings--nor lose the common touch, If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you; If all men count with you, but none too much, If you can fill the unforgiving minute With sixty seconds' worth of distance run, Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it, And--which is more--you'll be a Man, my son! --Rudyard Kipling

hiya peeps! I'm back!! been a great weekend... Bkt Merah is a beautiful place. The race was fun as usual. Siew ghee and guan lim are quite good company . and basically i enjoyed myself! Also glad that i managed to inspire the guys to take on tris from now on. ahhaha...u know what, if i were to bring any of you there, just by being there and mingling with those peeps is enough to get your adrenaline pumping! I mean if u talk the talk, u walk the walk man! hehe...wat else? that's it i guess...back to coll...hectic life...sigh...haha the ups n downs of life...makes me wonder if by going for the run i'm actually torturing myself or not. but, heck, we only live once! ahah that's like the motto of the ppl there! they're THAT cool !! so, here's to all of ya! live life...no matter what u do! live it!

bet u guys read this sometimes b4. some of u might just recieve it. well i did some adjustments to it as to show my sincerity and honesty =). the itallic words are my remarks Somewhere between the *procrastination* and the homework.. this i gotta agree And the incessant forwards and the friendships and the calls to each other complaining about CrUsHeS and BF/GF!! Somewhere between the phone calls to old friends and the "I miss you's", the "I love you's" and the "What are we doing tonight's?" And somewhere between all of the changing and growing... somewhere between the classes and the skipping classes...and the StUdYiNg for teStS...And the PRETENDING to "StUdY" for TeStS...And the downright NOT StUdYiNg for TeStS...( hell yeah! ) I forgot--I forgot what ScHooL was all about. Somewhere between all the appointments, starbucks coffee, and Mc Donald's... paying bills and then not paying bills... Making plans then breaking plans... Appearing, Disappearing, then reappearing... I forgot--I forgot what it was like to cry. I forgot that pretending to be happy doesn't make you happy... And that pretending to be SmArT doesn't make you smart .. I forgot that you can't just forget the past in fear of the FUTURE... I forgot that you can't control falling in LoVe.. And that you can't make yourself fall in *LoVe*.... I learned that I can LOVE...I learned that it's okay to MEsS UP.... And it's okay to ask for HELP!!!.. And it's okay to feel like crap... ( yea i bet everyone does once in a while ) I learned it's okay to cOmPLaiN and wHINe to all your friends for a whole day........ ( thanks ju and lyn !!) I learned that sometimes the things you want most you just can't have and the things that you look for are right in front of you. I learned that the greatest thing about HiGh ScHOoL and CoLLeGe and the working world it isn't about the parties or the DRiNKiNG or the Hookups ... ( er...not so sure bout drinking and hookups but definitely the parties...not forgetting get togethers with you guys after a period of time has passed and everyone has led their own lives differently for a while...yea...) It's the *FrIeNdShIpS*, which means taking chances. I learned that sometimes the things we want to forget are the things which we most need to talk about... I learned that TIME and LOVE can heal all things... I learned that just when you think it can't get worse - it does! ... ( gawd tell me about it man !) but with the love and support of friends - you survive... I've learned that when you start feeling BaD abou t L O S I N G touch and about those that you've lost! They too, are feeling the same way.... I learned that letters from friends are the most important things. And that sending cards to your friends makes you feel better! But, basically, I just learned that my friends........ Both old and new.....and my family...are the most important people to me in the world AND....... without them, I wouldn't be who I am today ..... So this is a THANK YOU to all of my friends... For always being there. And even if we're not on good terms or we have lost touch... I will always have an unconditional love for you.. ~Always and forever ~ so thanks...kam siah....xie xie...toh che...mm koi...terima kasih...=)

( usually it's just once a day ) but he doesn't irritate me much, dunno why. Mr Yap irritates me more. haha...tell u all also no use. =) okla. yao sui jiao liao. chai chien

woh...for how long have u had this up?? haha pretty cool...but coffee n cream!?!? ahahha today...i'm trying my best to enjoy every last second of my hols...come 7 am tmr i'll be jumping up to the sound of my alarm clock, getting ready for the gloom of college life once again. Somehow or another i'm squirming in my seat thinking of things that i missed out...like homework, assignments, Leo stuff even...oh well, once a student always a student! The fact that pacesetters got cancelled did not help. thought i could clear my mind and tire myself out the last time b4 the college life starts again. sigh...jus the thought of the dull lethargy is enough to make me flip with excitement! (again, i'm being sarcastic...) ok...r3n signing off...=)

Once you hit 40, it is time to think twice about miniskirts. Also, string bikinis, midriff-baring tops, skintight or low-rise jeans that have been sanded white the length of the thighs, as though the wearer had been tied to a bumper and dragged facedown around the block a few times. These are clothes for young people. Alas, this is what the stores are selling. Today's popular clothing chains appeal strictly to teenagers, who can be counted upon to change their tastes every 30 days, as the latest Cosmo Girl or Teen Vogue arrives in the mail. Customers like me cannot possibly afford new clothing more than once a decade, owing to the financial strain of paying for teenage children's rapidly shifting fashion needs. So no one bothers to make clothing for us. This is a dangerous situation. Expose a middle-aged woman to nothing but miniskirts and abbreviated tops for long enough, and she's bound to cave. One day, when her self-esteem is dangerously high and the dressing room lights dangerously low, she'll try on something designed for her daughter and say to herself, "Oh, why not?" If she happens to be shopping with her children, the answer to this question will be provided for her. But middle-aged husbands offer no such reality check. They live in a candyland of denial and residual carnality. They still, bless them, like to see a little flesh. My husband recently made me try on a bikini. A bikini is not so much a garment as a cloth-based reminder that your parts have been migrating all these years. My waist, I realized that day in the dressing room, has completely disappeared beneath my rib cage, which now rests directly on my hips. I'm exhibiting continental drift in reverse. The buttocks, too, have overrun their boundaries, infringing on territory that rightly belongs to the thighs. I have encouraged my thighs to do something about this -- restraining order, guard dog -- but they have not. Your thighs are rarely there for you. "Cute!" says Ed dementedly. "Turn around." "You turn around first." Ed does not understand what all women my age understand. The mature lady's buttock does not wish to come out and take a bow. Designers of mature ladies' swimwear know this. They've built little curtains into their designs, enabling the sagging buttock to keep hidden, and/or cast votes in privacy. God help me, I've entered the Age of Skirted Swimwear. This is the age right after Accessorizing with Reading Glasses and a few years before Can't Name Anyone on the Radio. Even the knees are in on the betrayal. I recently saw a tabloid photograph of a 40-something Demi Moore with her knees circled in red, highlighting the fact that they were disappearing under the shifting shoals of her thighs. Ha-ha, I said to myself. Just deserts for having a face and breasts (and a boyfriend) that look 25. Then I looked at my own knees, which I plan never to do again. The foot is more or less the one body part that time leaves alone. Well into your 70s, you can wear whatever style shoes you feel like wearing. Positioned, as they are, at the bottom of the heap, gravity is not an issue. Or so I thought. Shortly after the swimsuit debacle, I tried on a pair of pointy-toed black pumps, the sort that actresses on "Sex and the City" were wearing for 30 days back in spring. "How do those work for you?" the salesgirl asked. I told her they were pinching me, and not in an appreciative, you-look-just-like-that-gal-on- "Sex and the City" way. "You know," she said brightly, "your feet flatten as you age." I went to find Ed, and I told him about my flattening instep. He smiled and put his arm around me. That still fits, and for this I'm happy.

hi everyone!!...i've stared uni..in uniten already...as for some of u who dont know where it is...it's in bangi, puchong...come visit me sometime...the hostel is great..lecture halls are not bad...but only 1 thing, it just feels weird to be in a place filled with loads of guys n so few gals...not only tht...abt 70-80% are malays...so few chinese n indians...life in uni is tough...so wish me luck!!

hey ppl sunday was great great great even though i had to wake up at 7 to go for that karate competition but all is good .. anyway the day started off fine with my annual official position as " NAME CALLER " hahaha and this year i had karen as my apprentice yea shes good for starters .. but anyway thanks again karen .. anyway i was loud .. really loud .. i didnt know i could go so loud without straining my throat (it must be that voice from ur stomach thing the choir ppl use haahha) yea .. i was so happy when Jimmy this instructor from Seremban said "wah . you very good ar u can shout very loud" .. hearing that made me smile from ear to ear .. haha the funny part was like this at one point i asked karen to help me call the names of the contestants then she go call la .. then later i went there to help her call .. i jst called once really loud and the parent by the side was like "ahh liddat la!" haahhaa later part of the day this little girl came running playing with her little brother (i dont know this little girl) haha then u know la i pandai pandai disturb the girl abit abit then started chasing her around all she is SOOOO cute serious u can see in the picture im gonna post but then anyway .. she like comes on and off to kacau me la then one part i had to announce the names then the little girl was outside the court n she was like in that sad little cute face she said "kor kor .. kor kor" n like called for me so i brought her in carried her n announced the names .. finally at the end of the day when she had to go home she said this "kor kor lei ting yat lei tong ngo wan ar" translating it to english ... "kor kor pls come tmr to play with me" isnt that so adorable for that little kid .. haahah later at night sir belanjed us UNCLE CHILLIES at hilton .. wow was that the bomb .. he also was telling us that last time across the road was Auntie Belacan ..(ppl now adays create stupid names for competition) haha but the bill came up to a staggering 400 ++ bucks .. then later we all like keng kai at the pool place oww yea later at when we came out there was this really cool band playing n like the girl(singer) like was flirting with me showing some (I LUV U n ROCK ON) hand signals all HAAHA .. sir told me to take the to girls (Julie n Karen) to dance n he would give me 50 bucks .. i was so tempted but the girls didnt want to so .. ahahah .. it was nice the day ended quite tiring we went back at 10.30pm n i jst dropped dead to bed
